title: What Animation Canceling is
body:
Animation canceling simply put is inputting an alternate command such as a movement or ability. To overwrite the animation of the one in progress. This works on all Basic Attacks and almost every ability that doesn't have a cast time or channeling. It is also the very basis of *proper* kiting and DPS on an ADC or with AAs in general.

Thank you for reading.

Not necessarily. Proper kiting has you remove the backswing of your auto-attack so you can move earlier. It's vital in MOBA kiting and chasing, where you auto-attack, wait _just_ long enough for the attack to land and immediately move afterward to do it repeatedly. You're outright cancelling the backswing to move earlier. It's effectively the same as removing the end lag from your attacks in a fighting game. It's definitely cancelling part of the animation of an auto-attack.

An AA reset is also often used during the backswing of the AA to end it prematurely for the same reason as you'd use it to kite, but to reset the auto-attack timer so you can hit again immediately rather than move. AA-Q (during AA backswing)-AA is vital for champions like Nasus and Ezreal, and also other champions who have abilities that function similarly but on different keys, like Jax. Resets are not cancels, but due to how animations function in this game an AA reset can also cancel the attack, which means you can use it to cancel the backswing and immediately hit a second time in quick succession, generally much faster than you normally can.

There's a slight bit more to it, and it works **especially** on abillties **with** casttime.

Every animation consists of 3 parts:
The windup.
The resolve point
The backswing.

The resolve point is the point where damage, cc or whatever actually get applied or the projectile actually is lounched.
The _windup _is what happens befor that, and for spells it is also known as '_casttime_'.
The backswing is what comes after the resolve point is for aesthetics only.

What you normaly do with animation canceling is to cancle out the backswing part of an animation, so you wait till your AA/skill resolves properly and then you already give in the next comand instead of waiting for the full animation to finish.
You can cancle animation befor the resolve, but that ends in actually cancleing the full action as you won't get to the resolve point. A common mistake is beeing to hastey, especially when it comes to AAs, resulting in unintenditly canceling full attacks.
Especially on ranged champs, the animations can be missleading, as the resolvepoint is often after the visual launch of the projectile.
-----------------

An important thing to note is also that animation canceling has nothing to do with AA resets, atleast not directly. Even if you cancle the backswing of your AA, your next AA won't **resolve **faster. The time between two AA **RESOLVES** is fixed by your AS. What animation caneling does is allowing you to use the time in between two AAs more effectively, like weaving in spells or repositioning. 

AA resets are a different mechanic of specific skills, mostly empowered AAs, mobillity tools and some AA steroids, like Nauts W.
Some abillities have partial resets, which only resets some % off the attack timer, mostly AA steroids and mobillity tools.

Now some people might say 'bu-bu-but riven!'. 
Yea, riven combines resets and canceling. Her Qs partially reset the AA timer which was ment for her to feel more fluid and normaly has not that much impact because the Q animation is somewhat long, so you can't use the reset that well. However, if you animation cancle, you can now use the reset to it's full potential.
